Stop-loss strategy: Sell when the stock price falls by 10% from the current price, or when the EPS growth rate slows down to less than 5%
Trigger a sell order when the stock price drops by 15% from the current price or when the ROE and ROA indicators show a significant decline.
Sell when price drops by 15% from current price or when EPS turns negative again.
[Stop Loss Trigger: 15% decline from current price, Sell Order: When price reaches or falls below the calculated selling price]
